channel.title: News on Chicago Human+AI Lab
channel.description: Recent content in News on Chicago Human+AI Lab

item.title: Hypogenic AI
item.description: New blog: The Mirage of Autonomous AI Scientists, and check out Hypogenic AI.

item.title: Paper Accepted to COLM 2025!
item.description: Our new paper, On the Effectiveness and Generalization of Race Representations for Debiasing High-Stakes Decisions has been accepted to COLM 2025!

item.title: Concept Incongruence is Key to AI Safety and Creativity
item.description: Ever asked an LLM-as-Marilyn Monroe about the 2020 election? Our paper calls this concept incongruence, common in AI and human creativity. Paper available at:Concept Incongruence: An Exploration of Time and Death in Role Playing Read our blog to learn what we found, why it matters for AI safety and creativity, and what’s next.

item.title: Introducing HypoBench: Towards Systematic and Principled Benchmarking for Hypothesis Generation
item.description: Checkout the first principled benchmark on hypothesis generation! Paper available at: HypoBench: Towards Systematic and Principled Benchmarking for Hypothesis Generation.

item.title: Official website of: Literature Meets Data: A Synergistic Approach to Hypothesis Generation
item.description: Checkout the project website for our latest paper on hypothesis generation - Literature Meets Data: A Synergistic Approach to Hypothesis Generation!

item.title: Election NLP Project Launch
item.description: We have launched our Election NLP project website! This project will showcase the possibilities of using NLP to support humans’ political decision-making.

item.title: A Symposium on Communication & Intelligence
item.description: October 18th, 2024, 9:00 AM - 5:30 PM John Crerar Library, Room 390 Check out the Symposium Website for more information! The Symposium on Communication & Intelligence is a place to discuss how to think about the intertwining of Communication and Intelligence in an age of machines that talk back. We increasingly interact with technology that attempts (simulates?) communication with humans, rather than just signaling information passively for a user to interpret.
